intro: Gouldia macrocarpa, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a striking plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in winter. The plant produces large, showy bracts that give it its common name, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Gouldia macrocarpa is also known for its resilience to coastal conditions and salt spray.
